unnormalised: Alright folks, cricket season is almost upon us, and you know what that means – late nights, chai breaks, and heated debates about Kohli’s form! But before we get completely lost in the action, let’s get our calendars in order. Keeping track of every single match is a Herculean task, isn't it?
normalised: Alright folks, cricket season is almost upon us, and you know what that means – late nights, chai breaks, and heated debates about Kohli’s form! But before we get completely lost in the action, let’s get our calendars in order. Keeping track of every single match is a Herculean task, isn't it?

unnormalised: First up, we've got the Asia Cup. Supposedly starts around 08/27/2024, but the exact dates are still a bit hazy. Keep an eye out for the official announcement. Word on the street is that it’ll be hosted in Sri Lanka and Pakistan, but you know how things change last minute.
normalised: First up, we've got the Asia Cup. Supposedly starts around august twenty seventh two thousand and twenty four, but the exact dates are still a bit hazy. Keep an eye out for the official announcement. Word on the street is that it’ll be hosted in Sri Lanka and Pakistan, but you know how things change last minute.

unnormalised: Then, BAM! The big daddy of them all – the ICC T20 World Cup. It's slated to kick off sometime around 10/16/2024 and will go on until 11/13/2024 or so. Australia is the place to be, and you can bet your bottom rupee that stadiums will be packed to the brim. This one’s crucial, guys. We need to avenge that loss from last year. Remember that heartbreaking moment?!
normalised: Then, Bam! The big daddy of them all – the I-C-C T-twenty World Cup. It's slated to kick off sometime around october sixteenth two thousand and twenty four and will go on until november thirteenth two thousand and twenty four or so. Australia is the place to be, and you can bet your bottom rupee that stadiums will be packed to the brim. This one’s crucial, guys. We need to avenge that loss from last year. Remember that heartbreaking moment?!

unnormalised: And for those of you who prefer the longer format, don't fret! There's plenty of Test cricket on the horizon. India's tour of England should be sometime in mid-summer 2024. Plus, India vs. Australia Border-Gavaskar Trophy is always a thriller. Not too sure when it is but maybe late 2024, possibly early 2025, hopefully?
normalised: And for those of you who prefer the longer format, don't fret! There's plenty of Test cricket on the horizon. India's tour of England should be sometime in mid-summer two thousand and twenty four. Plus, India versus Australia Border-Gavaskar Trophy is always a thriller. Not too sure when it is but maybe late two thousand and twenty four, possibly early two thousand and twenty five, hopefully?

unnormalised: Don't even get me started on the IPL. It's a different beast altogether. Expect the IPL to start around April 2025. 60 days of pure, unadulterated cricket madness. It's basically a festival, right?
normalised: Don't even get me started on the I-P-L. It's a different beast altogether. Expect the I-P-L to start around April two thousand and twenty five. sixty days of pure, unadulterated cricket madness. It's basically a festival, right?

unnormalised: But it’s not just about international cricket, is it? The Pro Kabaddi League (PKL) is back on the scene, with Season 11 expected sometime in late 2024, or perhaps early 2025. They haven't given us an actual date to mark our calendars with, so let's just wait.
normalised: But it’s not just about international cricket, is it? The Pro Kabaddi League (P-K-L) is back on the scene, with Season eleven expected sometime in late two thousand and twenty four, or perhaps early two thousand and twenty five. They haven't given us an actual date to mark our calendars with, so let's just wait.

unnormalised: And before I forget, for all you football fans, keep your eyes peeled for the Indian Super League (ISL). I'm not quite sure about the start date this year, so it may be best to check it out when the tournament commences.
normalised: And before I forget, for all you football fans, keep your eyes peeled for the Indian Super League (I-S-L). I'm not quite sure about the start date this year, so it may be best to check it out when the tournament commences.

unnormalised: Let's not forget about the smaller tournaments that still make for interesting viewing. The Ranji Trophy, for example. I don't know when it is off the top of my head, but I'm sure those keen on it can easily find out.
normalised: Let's not forget about the smaller tournaments that still make for interesting viewing. The Ranji Trophy, for example. I don't know when it is off the top of my head, but I'm sure those keen on it can easily find out.

unnormalised: For all the information, you can check out ESPN or Cricinfo. I'm sure they'll have all the details for you.
normalised: For all the information, you can check out E-S-P-N or Cricinfo. I'm sure they'll have all the details for you.

unnormalised: So, there you have it – a (very) rough roadmap for the upcoming sporting calendar. Get your snacks ready, gather your friends, and prepare for a whole lot of excitement. Let the games begin!
normalised: So, there you have it – a (very) rough roadmap for the upcoming sporting calendar. Get your snacks ready, gather your friends, and prepare for a whole lot of excitement. Let the games begin!
